data.title: Metis
data.text:
Genealogy of the French in North America

Metis head of families

This table is a list of ancient Metis couples. They are couples formed by the union of a European and a Native spouse. A European is defined as having only European ancestors. A Native is a Native American or American Indian.

Beware : some people and organisms promote use of Metis for Western Metis only (i.e. the Metis Nation of Louis Riel) while most people don't pay attention to that detail. In this database, Metis or MÃ©tis means any person having both Native (or aboriginal) and European blood. In French, mÃ©tis is the adjective's form while MÃ©tis is the name's form.

The list is limited to French colonies in North America and to couples created before 1800. A couple can be married persons or persons having a child.

Metis from 2nd, 3rd, etc. generation are omitted, i.e. if the parents of a spouse are already considered as Metis.

When it is not possible to decide if a person is European or Native, the context is considered (no family name or Native type name and place of marriage for example). Generally, the type of the partner is used if the doubt is too high, i.e. a European with a Unknown will give European children.

General Statistics

In the whole population of the province of QuÃ©bec (computed from 100 couples married in 1939 and 1940), about 69% would have at least one Native line in their ancestry. Moreover, about 79% (figure of 2021) of the Quebecers with old French roots have some Native blood that can be found with a paper trail. Denis Beauregard can perform the relevant research for a fee.

Background colors mean:

Green: indicates there are descendants after 1899 in the database.

Blue: indicates there is no descendant after 1899 in the database but living descendants may exist

Notes :

The column "Descendants" indicates the marriages in the complete database, where some genealogies are private.

11/2032 means 11 generations and 2032 marriages of descendants in the database (duplicates not filtered).

() indicates the most recent marriage in the database.

[] indicates the most recent marriage in completely male or female line in the database (for DNA analysis)

The column "Estimated Living Descendants in Quebec" is based on 100 genealogies from couples married in the province of QuÃ©bec in 1939 and 1940.
